data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: Went without reservations but was still seated in the bar area which serves a full dinner menu.  I chose the roasted red pepper soup as a stater which looked gorgeous but was very bland. My husband and I actually thought the main dish wouldn't be good.   Thank the heavens, we were wrong!  I chose the halibut dish which was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  He selected the vegetarian dish which was soooo good!  We were impressed with the food although there was quite a wait between my soup and the main courses.  Regardless or waitress was great and such a little sweetie.  5 stars, two thumbs up and all that.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear MrsBRJean,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to provide a review of your experience. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your meal and received friendly service from our staff. We look forward to serving you again!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: My Favorite Restaurant in Anchorage
data.text:
We always celebrate special occasions with a dinner at the Crow's Nest. The place has a spectacular view of the Chugach Mountains to the East or the Alaskan Range to the North or the inlet to the West. You can never go wrong wherever you sit, just request for a table by a window. 

I love their food and their desserts. The foie gras and bone marrow appetizers are delectable. For entrees, I always go with the rib eye, halibut or cod. Try the bananas foster for dessert!

Service is always excellent. They have an extensive wine list and an in-house sommelier who can help you choose a good bottle for the meal.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear JSJAK907,

Thank you for celebrating with us at the Crow's Nest. We're pleased to hear that the beautiful views, attentive service, and menu keep you returning to dine with us. We appreciate the time you've taken to recommend us to others and we look forward to serving you on your next special occasion!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent food, service and views!
data.text: Absolutely delicious!! Started with a small corn bisque (gratis), then Crabbie patties,then a small salad that had a nice cheese, candied walnuts, different lettuces, vinaigrette. Then a beautiful ribeye steak with fingerling potatoes and broccoli florets... It came with a sauce that I wasn't crazy about, but still was a very nice steak. The sauce was on half the steak.. They brought two grand mariner chocolates with the bill that were scrumptious!!  GREAT service throughout. Stunning sunset over the Cook Inlet on one side of the restaurant and a gorgeous city view afterward on the other side. Reasonably priced..  I'll be back!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Colleenfromalaska,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest and taking the time to let others know what you enjoyed. We're happy to hear it was a wonderful experience and that you enjoyed all of the courses. Our staff is dedicated to deliver excellent service in order to provide a memorable evening for our guests. We look forward to serving you again soon!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Always wonderful
data.text: From the breathtaking view to the fine dining and the historic ownership of the Captain Cook, expect only the finest!

data.title: Special Place for a Special Dinner
data.text: Great ambiance, quiet and comfortable.  Of course the views of Cook Inlet and the mountains are great.  Chelsea was not only our humorous server but doubled as photographer and provided great service.  She also provided good advice on our wine choice.  I had the soup special, beet salad, and crab and halibut on couscous with green beans, which was great.  Worth the bucks.

data.title: Fancy!
data.text: There's not a bad view in the house, we were lucky it was a full moon that night- the view are amazing. We love the decor is retro 70's (not a lot of those around anymore). It's definitely five star dining and service- and price!

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Weeuns,

Thank you for dining at The Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to provide this lovely review. It's such an incredible view from our 20th floor. We're happy to hear that our staff and menu made it an enjoyable evening. We hope to serve you again soon!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great view and good service
data.text: I popped up for a quick drink in the bar as it was recommended as a great place to watch the sun go down; I missed that but the lights of downtown Anchorage were really pretty. The margarita was good: the burger ($16) was great and the service was friendly. I saw lots of couples going for both smart meals in the restaurant and informal drinks in the bar area where I sat. Lovely way to finish my week's stay in Anchorage.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Peta S,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to let others know about your experience. It sounds like you had a relaxing and enjoyable time with us. We hope you'll return to Anchorage and dine with us again!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not to be missed
data.text: Expensive, difficult to secure a reservation. True. But once you are seated-the experience begins. Fabulous presentation, fabulous service, fabulous surroundings-relaxed. Occupied the table for hours-no pressures. The food was not extraordinary, but certainly good. I love it here, and will return again when in Anchorage. The time we spent was well worth the trouble and expense.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Trent B,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to recommend us to others. We're glad that you enjoyed the presentation that we offer. We want all of our guests to savor both the cuisine and the experience of the evening, so we never rush our diners. We look forward to your return visit!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful views!
data.text: This is an up scale restaurant with beautiful views.   Food was delicious and prepared as ordered.   The staff was professional and did not attempt to push you out or along.   Would eat here again.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We're happy to hear that everything from the view to the delicious menu to the helpful staff made it a memorable experience. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to serving you again!

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Given the hype a little disappointing
data.text:
We had been anticipating catching up with Anchorage friends for some time and their suggestion of the Crow's Nest as a location for dinner looked great.  We were staying in the hotel and the menu looked fantastic.  The evening before I had passed up the opportunity for a crab fest at a hotel some distance away expecting to see fresh crab at the 'Nest.

Well, crab was on the menu but there is no way that it should have been called fresh.  Tough and very dry - somewhat disappointing.  The balance of the meal was good, the service to the standard expected and the view spectacular - Mt McKinley in all it's glory after many days hidden.  Having been awaiting a succulent feast of fresh crab legs displayed in all their glory for my $50+ (excl tax and gratuities) it was enough to downgrade the experience to 'never again'.
.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Tim B,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to provide feedback about your experience. I am sorry to hear that you were disappointed with the meal. We strive to give our guests a memorable dining experience through both delicious cuisine and stellar customer service. We hope that you'll return for a better experience in the future.

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A fun splurge
data.text:
I've eaten here twice in the past year.  The first time, this winter, was just for dessert and drinks...very memorable on both counts, especially the Bananas Foster flambe.

This summer we decided to have dinner.  At a busy time we would have gotten a better table if we had a reservation...the views were still good.  They were busy, so service was not as attentive, still good, but not spectacular.  

A month later I don't remember what I had for dinner, but it was good.  The Bananas Foster was prepared in a hurry.

This winter I would have given the restaurant a 5.  This summer a 3.  Apparently the experience is better when they are less busy.  It was expensive for a "3."

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear CarolynD53,

Thank you for dining at the Crow's Nest. We appreciate you taking the time to provide feedback about your experiences. We're happy you had such a great experience coming in for dessert that you decided to return this summer for dinner. I'm sorry to hear that it wasn't as memorable as your first visit. It is so important that our guests feel like they can enjoy their time and not hurry through their meal. We hope you'll dine with us again for an exquisite experience.

Louisa, Concierge
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Still great food, impecible service, and a wonderful view.
data.text: a very long time special friend and frequent Crow'd Nest patron invited both me and my european visitor to dinner here.  We enjoyed the perfect service, fine  gourmet  meals , and fine wine selection that the Crow's nest has been known for .   I had not eaten here in some time, and it was a treat as always.

data.title: Poor service, food
data.text: This restaurant came as a recommendation from our tour company.  Service and food were lousy.  Overpriced.  Skip this place and head to Simon and Sefords instead. Still has the view but much better food and service.

data.title: Best View in Anchorage
data.text: The view and ambiance are excellent. The wine list rivals that of a big town, high priced Bay Area restaurant. The menu was creative and featured some unique meats such as boar and oxtail.

data.title: Perfect for Drinks and a Bite
data.text: Wanted to see the view. Surprised by how good the food and drinks were!  Tasty. pricey, but worth the splurge. Friendly staff, feels elegant and hip.  Great selection of high end alcohol, interesting appetizers. And you can eat at the bar!

data.title: Excellent views
data.text: This place has excellent views of the city and the water.  The drinks were very good and the staff was very friendly.  The food was good as well.  They had some nice bar snacks while we waited for a table.

data.title: Rude Hostess
data.text: We went for drinks but the Hostess was so rude Saturday, August 20, 2016 we left.  We went to Fletcher's instead. Fletcher's staff were awesome.

owner_response.author: cookconcierge, Guest Relations Manager at The Crow's Nest, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

I appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback about your experience at the Crow's Nest. I am so sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We take this situation very seriously, as it is our top priority to show our guests friendly attentiveness. We appreciate that you still dined in Fletcher's and we're happy to hear that the staff was helpful with giving you a great experience. We look forward to getting the chance to serve you again in the future.

data.title: Excellent Dinner
data.text: Good food, good service, good ambiance equal excellent dinner.  Had the halibut and the scallops and enjoyed both.  Had the Meyer lemon dessert which was lovely.

data.title: Great View - Wonderful Dinne
data.text: Even on a misty Anchorage evening, the view was great.  The server was professional and friendly.  Black Cod and grilled scallops were wonderful as were the sides.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Good pub grub ( the lentil soup with reindeer sausage was great and reasonably priced) and extensive draft beer selection with a lot of local choices. Convenient for hotel guests and quite a few locals. Some parking available . Service is professional and friendly and the final bill was less than expected.
